Description: Lower body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater; interior: glazed black; exterior: red figure-decoration consisting of the bottom parts of two figures: on left, foot facing right; on right, bottom of drapery of figure facing left; below the scene, stopt meander (broken) to left above black-glazed zone. Ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Piekarski place the fragment near Group G and the Filottrano Painter and gives the following compranda: ARV2 1453, 1-4. 6-9. 11-14. 16-21.23. 26-32; 1455, 1-5 (=1694, 13bis-19); 1468, 137-160; 1694, 9bis.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p. 43, no. C23, pl. 16, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1036)
